thread.title: Man United star Zlatan Ibrahimovic blames Tyrone Mings for nasty clash
thread.title_full: Man United star Zlatan Ibrahimovic blames Tyrone Mings for nasty clash

title: Man United star Zlatan Ibrahimovic blames Tyrone Mings for nasty clash
text:
Man United star Zlatan Ibrahimovic blames Tyrone Mings for nasty clash ZLATAN IBRAHIMOVIC insists he did not intentionally elbow Tyrone Mings. PUBLISHED: 15:36, Sat, Mar 4, 2017 | UPDATED: 15:40, Sat, Mar 4, 2017 GETTY Zlatan Ibrahimovic insists he didn't elbow Tyrone Mings intentionally 
The duo made the headlines in Manchester United’s 1-1 draw with Bournemouth this afternoon. 
Shortly before half-time Mings appeared to stamp on Ibrahimovic’s head while the Swede was on the floor. 
Moments after Ibrahimovic had his retribution as his elbow connected with Mings’ head when they went up for a header from a corner. 
But Ibrahimovic says it wasn’t intentional. Zlatan Ibrahimovic v Tyrone Mings: Should both players have been sent off? Sat, March 4, 2017 Do these pictures prove both Zlatan Ibrahimovic and Tyrone Mings should have received red cards during Manchester United's clash with Bournemouth? 1 of 12 Should both Tyrone Mings and Zlatan Ibrahimovic have been sent off? 
Ibrahimovic said: "Listen, what happens on the field stays on the field. I'm not someone who attacks someone off the field. You have the TV, you can see the images. I jump up and jump high and he [Mings] jumps into my elbow." 
"It is not my intention to hurt someone. I didn't know about the stamping on the head, if it was him it was him." 
Mings added: ”It was a good battle, you know what you're going to get playing against him. I enjoyed the battle all day. 
"What he possesses in height in strength I also possess, we had to ride a lot of storms but we stood up to the test very well. 
"I've watched him growing up through his career and dreamt of days like this."
